paper_metadata.title: An Energy Consumption Estimation Method for the Tool Setting Process in CNC Milling Based on the Modular Arrangement of Predetermined Time Standards

process_parameters.feed_rate: X-axis: 1500/500 mm/min, Y-axis: 1500/500 mm/min, Z-axis: 1500 mm/min (up/down)

energy_data.power_consumption: Standby: 530 W, Spindle rotating: 177.85 W @700 rpm, X-axis feeding: 36.22 W @1500 mm/min, 25.32 W @500 mm/min, Y-axis feeding: 16.32 W @1500 mm/min, 5.62 W @500 mm/min, Z-axis feeding: 53.73 W @1500 mm/min (up), 9.87 W @1500 mm/min (down)
energy_data.measurement_method: Yokogawa WT1800 power analyzer + MODAPTS-based time estimation model

kpi_metrics.efficiency: Time estimation error: 7.14%, Energy estimation error: 8.26%
other_kpis: energy_proportion_tool_setting: 21.60% of total machining energy (from previous study)
energy_reduction_lower_spindle_speed: 3.52% reduction when spindle speed reduced from 700 to 500 r/min

additional_notes: Focuses exclusively on energy consumption during tool setting process (preparatory phase), which is typically ignored in machining energy studies. Uses MODAPTS (Modular Arrangement of Predetermined Time Standards) method for human operation time estimation. Only considers square workpieces. Method can be used to establish energy consumption allowances and labor-hour quotas for tool setting processes.
